name: Teknologi for integrerte operasjoner og semantisk web

questions.question: [.NET /C#] What best describe "Microsoft .NET"/.NET Framework?
answers: Platform/Windows component for development and execution of different types of applications by using different programming languages.
Virtual machine for running managed code (like the Java Virtual Machine, JVM)
General guidelines on how to write applications for Windows
Framework for developing SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) applications

questions.question: [.NET /C#] What is an assembly in .NET?
answers: Add-in to Visual Studio, extending it with new features
Unit containing highly optimized machine code, ready to be executed at full speed, a big competitive advantage for .NET
Any file with a .dll file extension
Classes and their source code and resources are compiled into an assembly, which is a main building block in .NET applications

questions.question: [.NET /C#] What is MSIL (Microsoft Intermediate Language)?
answers: High-level programming language like C# and Visual Basic .NET
A language that is outputted from for instance the C# compiler, and is what .NET assemblies contain
Regular English written language used in specialized requirements specifications
A language Microsoft intended should be the new C++, but later abandoned and went for C# instead (thereof intermediate)
None of these

questions.question: [.NET /C#] Does C# have Garbage Collection? If yes, what is it?
answers: C# does NOT have garbage collection
C# HAS garbage collection, which is a function in Visual Studio for cleaning up your source code
C# HAS garbage collection, which is an automatic process in the CLR which frees unused (unreachable) memory during program execution.
C# HAS garbage collection, which is a compiler feature that removes unused code.

questions.question: [.NET /C#] We are implementing the class B, which should inherit from A and implement the interface IDisposable. Which of the following code snippets show the correct way of doing this in C#? … indicates the contents of the class.
answers: public class B extends A implements IDisposable    { ... }
public class B : A implements IDisposable    { ... }
public class B : A, IDisposable    { ... }
public class B inherits A, IDisposable    { ... }
None of these

questions.question: [.NET /C#] Does C# support multiple inheritance?
answers: Yes, both from classes and interfaces
Only from interfaces, not classes
No, not at all

questions.question: [.NET /C#] Can .NET programs (for instance a class library) written in VB.NET be used from C# code?
answers: No, this is not possible
Yes it is possible, but requires very "dirty tricks" and is generally not a good idea
Yes, but it requires you to run the VB2C# converter tool to convert the VB code to C#
Yes, it is enough to add a reference to the assembly written in VB.NET

questions.question: [.NET /C#] What is the difference between classes (class A { … }) and structs (struct B { … }) in C#?
answers: There are no major differences, like in C++, where a struct is a class with everything being public
There are no differences at all
Structs are lightweight data containers, a value type passed by value, residing on the runtime stack instead of the heap
None of these

questions.question: [.NET /C#] What will the following code print (if inserted into the main method of a program)?
answers: 'False'
'True'
The answer depends on the memory allocations in each run of the program
The code does not compile and cannot be run; nothing is printed

questions.question: [WCF] Which of the alternatives below best describe what a web service is?
answers: Internet site with extra functionality, such as a web shop (thereby extra service)
Web site using HTTP and HTTPS as its primary protocols
Any application listening on TCP port number 80 is a web service
A programmable application, accessible trough standard internet protocols, designed for machine to machine interaction

questions.question: [WCF] What best describes SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol)?
answers: Platform INDPENDENT protocol for exchanging XML messages over computer networks, usually over HTTP/HTTPS
Platform DEPENDENT protocol for exchanging XML messages over computer networks, usually over HTTP/HTTPS
Protocol for sending HTML over TCP/IP
Replacement for TCP when sending XML data over HTTP
Binary protocol for sending binary XML data over UDP

questions.question: [WCF] Which of the alternatives below lists technologies, in the same order, corresponding to the following items: 1) represent data (structured storage), 2) message protocol, 3) data- and operation contract.
answers: UDDI, XML, SOAP
XML, SOAP, WSDL
DISCO, XML, WSDL
None of these

questions.question: [WCF] The document format for WSDLs (Web Service Description Language) is
answers: Plain text
Binary format
CSV (Comma separated values
XML
None of these

questions.question: [WCF] What is the relation between SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) and WCF?
answers: WCF and SOA is the same
WCF is Microsoft’s platform for, amongst others, building SOA applications
SOA is a specific technology, WCF is a generalized view of how distributed applications should be built
None of these
